courses.subject: CSCI
courses.title: Hands-on Introduction to C++

meetings.location: William M W Mong Eng Bldg 404
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 404
William M W Mong Eng Bldg 404

courses.description: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the C++ programming language. Topics include the basic C++ language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, program flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the C++ programming language such as object-oriented methodology, class templates, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, etc. will be highlighted.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CSCI1120 or 1520 or 1540 or ESTR1100.
courses.learning_outcomes: 1. Be able to write, compile and execute Standard C++ programs 2. Be able to make use of C++'s object-oriented methodology 3. Be able to develop object-oriented program using classes, inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the C++ programming language. Topics include the basic C++ language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, program flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the C++ programming language such as object-oriented methodology, class templates, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, etc. will be highlighted.
courses.feedback_evaluation: 1. Course evaluation and questionnaire 2. Results of assignments and examination 3. Question-and-Answer sessions during class 4. Student consultation during office hours or online
courses.recommended_readings: 1. Problem Solving with C++ (6th edition), Walter Savitch, Addison-Wesley. 2006 2. The C++ Programming Language (3rd Edition), Bjarne Stroustru, Addison-Wesley 3. C++ Primer Plus (5th Edition), Stephen Prata, Sams

courses.subject: CSCI
courses.title: Hands-on Introduction to Java
courses.description: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the Java programming language. Topics include the basic Java language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, program flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the Java programming language such as object-oriented methodology, class templates, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, etc. will be highlighted.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken CSCI1130 or 1530 or ESTR1102.
courses.learning_outcomes: 1. Be able to write, compile and execute Java programs 2. Be able to make use of Java's object-oriented methodology 3. Be able to design and create applications using Java Foundation Classes (JFC) 4. Be able to develop object-oriented program using classes, inheritance, encapsulation, and polymorphism
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the Java programming language. Topics include the basic Java language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, program flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the Java programming language such as object-oriented methodology, class templates, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism, etc. will be highlighted.
courses.feedback_evaluation: 1. Course evaluation and questionnaire 2. Results of assignments and examination 3. Question-and-Answer sessions during class 4. Student consultation during office hours or online
courses.recommended_readings: 1. Introduction to Java Programming: Fundamentals First (6th Edition) (GOAL Series) (Paperback), Daniel Liang, Prentice Hall, 2006

courses.subject: CSCI
courses.title: Hands-on Introduction to Python
courses.description: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the Python scripting language. Topics include the basic Python language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, programme flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the Python scripting language such as object-oriented support, high level dynamic data types, embedding within applications etc. will be highlighted.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken AIST1110 or CSCI1550 or IERG1080
courses.learning_outcomes: 1. Be able to write, compile and execute Python programs; 2. Be able to make use of Python's object-oriented methodology; 3. Be able to design and create applications using Python modules; 4. Be able to develop embedded applications using Python.
courses.course_syllabus: This course aims to provide an intensive hands-on introduction to the Python scripting language. Topics include the basic Python language syntax, variable declaration, basic operators, programme flow and control, defining and using functions, file and operating system interface. Specific key features of the Python scripting language such as object-oriented support, high level dynamic data types, embedding within applications etc. will be highlighted.
courses.feedback_evaluation: 1. Course evaluation and questionnaire; 2. Results of assignments and examination; 3. Question-and-Answer sessions during class; 4. Student consultation during office hours or online;
courses.required_readings: 1. Official Python web site http://www.python.org; 2. Beginnersâ€™ guide to Python http://wiki.python.org/moin/BeginnersGuide.
